reviews.sentence: Airport shuttle bus. I was in Houston for training Hotel location is way far from down town or most important attractions in Texas but the Airport shuttle bus made it extremely easy for me to go for free to Airport where I can rent a car for my personal trips. Make sure you book your rented car in advance to get good prices believe it or not i got it once for 20 you can also get the bus to down town which is across the road. The room was spacious and clean.

Great Hotwire Buy. Scored this hotel for 50 as a Hotwire special. Yet again Hotwire did not disappoint. Nice place for the. Clean pool room hot shower. Note that there is no free breakfast at this location. On site restaurant is a great value kids eat free with stay. Only issue we had was high humidity in room over 80. Common areas are fine.

Awesome. We got a really good deal here. The room was very nice clean and spacious. The restaurant was nice and the staff delightful. The hotel staff was equally as good. They even paid for our ride to the airport in the morning as we had to go before their shuttle started. I highly recommend this hotel.

Holiday inn intercontinental. The room was perfect for two people. The bed was the best part of the stay. I was a little disappointed in the bathroom size but it was a normal hotel bathroom and did provide complementary shampoo etc.

Pleasantly Surprised Just a couple of minor issues with key cards and housekeeping. I will admit I was hesitant to stay here after reading some of the reviews but I booked through a third party so I was stuck. My son and I arrived around 130 on Saturday March 12th. Our room was not available yet but I explained that we had an event that were attending and we needed to get in our room to shower and get cleaned up. She found us a clean room in a couple of minutes and we were on our way. I had called a couple of days before to request a fridge and microwave. She explained the room should have one but if not they would bring it right up. The room did not have one when we arrived but as we were leaving after we checked in I told her and she said she would take care of it ASAP. When we came back everything had been set up and plugged in and someone had put in my water and juice into the fridge to keep it cold. The room the room looked recently remodeled and it was very clean. And I mean very clean. I am very very picky about cleanliness and will walk out of a hotel if it is not clean. Our room was immaculate the sheets and towels were very clean and white. no stains and the bed was super comfortable. No stains on the carpet or curtains and the bathroom was especially clean. Shower pressure was not the greatest and it took a while for the water to warm up but atleast it was clean and there was enough counter space for all my stuff. The WIFi worked great and there was enough cable channels to keep both of entertained. Overall I was very pleased with the room. Now my issues. One the first night we were there. I had left some trash in a bag beside the trash can because there was not any room left in the trash can. When we returned the trash was still sitting on the floor and the bathroom trash did not get emptied at all for two days. Also room service trays sat out in the hallway for two days before they were cleared. The trays were not mine but belonged to the customer in the room across from us And I know it was the same tray. It was gross and it was starting to smell. The room was always clean as was the bathroom but the trash kept getting left behind. Second issue we had was the key cards. The cards would just quit working for whatever reason. But one night we arrived at the hotel at close midnight and our cards would not work. I had to go back down twice to get the cards reprogramed. The third time I went back down the front desk clerk stated she would have to get security to let us into the room. So we had to wait by our door for 15 min while he went and let other guests into their rooms as they were having the same issues as well He commented the locks were old and needed to be replaced and I agree with him. Please replace the locks as soon as possible. The pool did not appear to be open but it was too cool anyway. I did not use the restaurant or bar so I can not comment on that. The lobby was clean and there were luggage cards readily available as well. The parking lot is not big enough for the amount of cars I saw during our four night stay. Every night when we would return we had a hard time finding parking. We had to park around the back by the pool just about every night with the exception of one night. The only reason I would not stay here again is because there in nothing in terms of food and shopping around the hotel. The front desk directed us to a Taco Bell down the street on JFK but there did not seem to much down JFK either just more hotels. There was no street noise coming into the hotel and that was a plus for me. I was able to get downtown in about 25 minutes. Close to IAH and they do offer a shuttle from what I saw.
Nice room and pool.
The room was very nice and check in was super easyThe ac was out in the lobby The restaurant had a limited menu and one woman that was in management kept giving us dirty looks for no reason.

Great location near IAH airport. Great hotel if you have an early morning flight. Free shuttle to and from the airport. Very big clean full service hotel with a really good restaurant. Fitness center is full service. Rooms are large and comfortable. I recommend this property and will stay here again.

excellent facility. room was very clean and spacious. front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. shuttles were timely and even included a trip to the mall. not much in walking distance. would go back again but wished that breakfast was included.
Convenient and Clean hotel. Convenient to airport friendly staff clean rooms.

The hotel has a decent ambience. However the staff is somewhat laid back. As its quite an old property there are lots of maintenance issues here. During my stay there was a 24 hr power outage elevators not working even after power restored various issues inside the room AC not working though it was repaired on intimation toilet flush broken etc etc.

My bathroom flooded. My bathroom Flooded from a clogged drain in a wheelchair accessible king room. When I notified the front desk they told me to spend the night in the room and that I could be moved the next morning to another king room. The front desk mentioned that no more king rooms were available and that I could be moved to a double even though I paid for a king when I booked online in advance. I was told that I could n’t get a refund and had to go back in forth with them for over an hour for a refund. The manager insisted that I could just stay in the room with the soaking wet carpet until morning. The hotel is old the rooms are out of date front desk is rude and it ’s definitely not worth the money.

This was the worst hotel that we ever stayed in the hall and the elevator was awful and had a musty and damp smell and the room was even worst. The bed was lumpy and and room had an awful smell too and there silverfish all over the place and the toilet broke. could not flush it had to take the top off to flush it. Is hotel need a lot of work. We slept with the lights on. Will not stay here again.

Given the options of airport hotels available avoid this one until the hotel gets a complete makeover. In its current state cockroach and bugs in room strong bleach and mildew smell mustiness damp carpets very dim rooms poor water pressure in shower noisy a c there is hardly anything desirable about staying at this Holiday Inn. We were put up here by our airline due to flight issues resulting in an overnight. The only saving grace here for the 2 stars were the surprisingly comfortable beds and a great restaurant at the lobby which was equally presentable. However once you step into the elevators and walk through the corridors of the hotel it is hard not to feel dreadful especially after a long day of travel. Real shame for what is an international hotel brand.
Clean lobby. Easy check in. Room was weirdly humid even after running the ac nonstop but hopefully that was just my room. The rest of the room was nice.

Inexpensive stay with some complications. Shuttle is nice to haveRestaurant is niceValue for the money. We booked room with sofa but initially were placed in the room without one. After realizing and switching rooms we determined there is no sheets for sofa. Service request was slow and we waited for more than 90 minutes for sheets that were supposed to be in the room in the first place instead of having rest before 5 am wake up timeSome pipe noise was there all night sounded like hammer on a wall. Cleanliness of the room desired to be better.

Got a great rate via Priceline for Holiday Inn near Bush International it is not a bad place but not that great either. I give it 3 stars out of 5 for this rated 3 star hotel. While the location is convenient to the airport I was surprised just how loud air traffic is in out. I have stayed at hotels that are physically closer but yet rooms were much quieter both to external noise and noise from nearby rooms. In fact sitting in my room as I type this review I can hear my neighbor talking on the phone well enough to almost tell you what he is saying verbatim. Check in was rather fast and ok but going to my room I quickly realized why the hotel was available at such a discount it apparently has not been updated since 197. The room has some crazy striped carpet with a love seat and office chair that one might find at a Salvation Army store. The desk area was fairly large though and was nice for working at for the things I needed to finish up after getting in from work. The bed was fine bathroom was fine with good water pressure though no exhaust fan and everything else was ok. So thus my ok rating. Aside from the decor and noise nothing bad. But nothing really good either.

Had stayed here some years ago and it was ok for a short stay close to airport. But this time I found out that the hotel and room were dirty. Found bugs on bathroom and room floor. The only highlight is that personnel was friendly.

The renovation was not worth the money. I have stayed at this IHG property twice in the last 40 days. Either I was unlucky enough to receive old rooms or the hotel is simply wasting its money on the renovation. In the first room the smoke alarm was missing and its mounting frame was dangling by wires from the wall. In the second room the smoke alarm was not connected. I am pretty sure the fire marshal would have something to say about that. In both rooms there were no power receptacles anywhere near the bed. How does a hotel justify that in todays world. If the renovation is not going to put receptacles in usable locations it should at least put lamps with receptacles on the night stands. The shower in the second room had a defective hot water valve. It took 15 minutes for the shower to reach a usable temperature. The door in the first room had a fist sized hole in it at floor level. A coworker traveled with me on the second trip he said the bathroom in his room was moldy. I gave the rating a 2 because the bed was comfortable. I have given this property enough opportunity to improve. I am not going back.

The rooms we were assigned smell of water damage smoke and urine. We are traveling with small children and were given rooms along the highway so we have been listening to cars and trucks from 11 pm to 4 am non stop. The restaurant had some issues preparing the food which ended up being unappetizing. The shuttle runs on demand so they will not pick you up unles you call. We called and still waited over an hour to be picked up and driven to the hotel. Zero stars.
